   NOTE: Where vegetative stabilization techniques may cause structural
instability or are otherwise unobtainable, alternative stabilization techniques
must be employed. These techniques may include mulching or erosion matting.
      (5)   Inlet Protection. Erosion and sediment control practices, such as
boxed inlet protection, shall be installed to minimize sediment- laden water
entering active storm drain systems, including rear yard inlets. Straw, hay
bales, and filter socks around an inlet or hay bales are not acceptable forms
of inlet protection.
      (6)   Silt fence and other Perimeter Controls. Silt fence and other
perimeter controls approved by the Village of Glenwillow shall be used to
protect adjacent properties and water resources from sediment discharged vis
sheet (diffused) flow. Silt fence shall be placed along level contour and the
permissible drainage area is limited to those indicated in the Construction
General Permit.
      (7)   Temporary sediment traps: Where site conditions exceed the
capabilities of silt fence, sediment traps shall be implemented as the primary
means of sediment control along the perimeter of disturbed areas. Temporary
diversions shall be used as necessary to route sediment-laden runoff to the
trap.
      (8)   Temporary mulching: Due to its' ease of implementation, relatively
low-cost and high-effectiveness at abating erosion, periodic applications of
straw mulch or equivalent materials, should be planned for every site.
      (9)   Rock check dams: Check dams shall be utilized in areas of
concentrated flow during active construction periods so as to minimize scouring
of the bottom of swales and ditches.
      (10)   Erosion control matting: Matting shall be used in areas of
concentrated flow (e.g. ditches, side and rear yard swales, etc.) where flow
will exceed 3.5 fps for a 10 year, 24-hr. design storm. It shall only be
utilized at the time of final stabilization.
      (11)   Internal Inspection and Maintenance. All controls on the
development area shall be inspected at least once every seven (7) calendar days
and within twenty-four (24) hours after any storm event greater than one-half
inch of rain per twenty-four (24)-hour period. Maintenance shall occur as
detailed below:
         A.   When SCMs require repair or maintenance. If the internal
inspection reveals that a SCM is in need of repair or maintenance, with the
exception of a sediment-settling pond, it must be repaired or maintained within
three (3) days of the inspection. Sediment settling ponds must be repaired or
maintained within ten (10) days of the inspection.
         B.   When SCMs fail to provide their intended function. If the
internal inspection reveals that a SCM fails to perform its intended function
and that another, more appropriate SCM is required, the Abbreviated SWP3 must
be amended and the new SCM must be installed within ten (10) days of the
inspection.
         C.   When SCMs depicted on the Abbreviated SWP3 are not installed. If
the internal inspection reveals that a SCM has not been implemented in
accordance with the schedule, the SCM must be implemented within ten (10) days
from the date of the inspection. If the inspection reveals that the planned SCM
is not needed, the record must contain a statement of explanation as to why the
SCM is not needed.
      (12)   Final Stabilization: Final stabilization shall be determined by
the Village Engineer or his or her designee.
         (Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.11 FEES.
   The SWP3 and Abbreviated SWP3 review, filing, and inspection fee is part of
a complete submittal and is required to be submitted to the Village of
Glenwillow before the review process begins. Please consult with Village
Engineer for current fee schedule.
   (a)   The owner shall initially pay a fee as determined by the Building
Department to defray the cost of professional review and inspection of the
owner's plan.
   (b)   The Finance Director shall deposit all fees received under Section
1192.11 of this Regulation into a fund under the name of the owner depositing
such money. All expenses incurred by the Village for the review and inspection
of the owner's plan and the subject site shall, upon proper authorization, be
paid by the Finance Director out of such fund.
   (c)   If, at any time prior to the completion of the project for which the
owner has sought approval, any individual fund has a balance of less than two
hundred fifty dollars ($250.00), the Finance Director shall request in writing
that the owner pay a fee, within ten (10) days of such written request,
additional funds to create a fund balance of not less than five hundred dollars
($500.00).
   (d)   The Village Engineer, or his or her designee, shall notify the Finance
Director at such time when the Village's review and inspection process for each
case has been completed and no additional professional reviews or inspections
are necessary. The Finance Director, or his or her designee, shall verify with
all professional reviewers and inspectors that they have submitted all of their
invoices and that these invoices have been paid for that particular case. The
Finance Director shall then promptly refund the balance of any fees for that
particular case to the entity who made such payment with the Village.
      (Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.12 BOND.
   (a)   If a SWP3 or Abbreviated SWP3 is required by this regulation, soil
disturbing activities shall not be permitted until a cash bond has been paid
with the Village Finance Department. The bond amount shall be at least one
thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500.00) for the first acre of land to be
disturbed or fraction thereof, plus an additional one thousand five hundred
dollars ($1,500.00) shall be paid deposited for each subsequent acre or
fraction thereof. The bond will be used by the Village to perform the
obligations otherwise to be performed by the owner of the development area as
stated in this regulation and to allow all work to be performed as needed in
the event that the owner fails to comply with the provisions of this
regulation. Any unused portion of the cash bond shall be returned after all
work required by this regulation has been completed and final stabilization has
been reached, all as reasonably determined by the Village Engineer.
   (b)   The bond will be retained until all areas disturbed by construction
activity are permanently stabilized. Where vegetative growth is used to achieve
permanent stabilization, the area shall comply with final stabilization
requirements of the Construction General Permit.
   (c)   Upon the failure of the owner and/or developer and/or contractor(s) to
complete any work ordered by the Village Engineer, the Village may elect to
contract with others or employ its own employees to remedy all or part of the
said unfinished work and the owner and/or developer and/or contractor(s) shall
be liable to the Village of Glenwillow for the cost of such work and for the
cost to the Village to collect its costs if not paid upon presentment. The
Village shall have the right to enter upon the disturbed lands to correct such
failure and to abate any nuisance found.
   (d)   No project subject to this regulation shall commence without a SWP3 or
Abbreviated SWP3 approved by the Village Engineer.
(Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.13 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   If the Village or its duly authorized representative determines that a
violation of the rules adopted under this code exist, the Village or
representative may issue an immediate stop work order if the violator failed to
obtain any federal, state, or local permit necessary for sediment and erosion
control, earth movement, clearing, or cut and fill activity.
   (b)   All development areas are subject to external inspections by the
Village to ensure compliance with the approved SWP3 or Abbreviated SWP3.
   (c)   After each external inspection, the Village shall prepare and
distribute a status report to the owner.
   (d)   If an external inspection determines that operations are being
conducted in violation of the approved SWP3 or Abbreviated SWP3 the Village may
take action as detailed in Section
1192.14 of this regulation.
(Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.14 VIOLATIONS.
   (a)   No person shall violate or cause or knowingly permit to be violated
any of the provisions of this regulation, or fail to comply with any of such
provisions or with any lawful requirements of any public authority made
pursuant to this regulation, or knowingly use or cause or permit the use of any
lands in violation of this regulation or in violation of any permit granted
under this regulation.
   (b)   Upon notice, the Building Department may suspend any active soil
disturbing activity for a period not to exceed ninety (90) days, and may
require immediate erosion and sediment control measures whenever he or she
determines that such activity is not meeting the intent of this regulation.
Such notice shall be in writing, shall be given to the owner, and shall state
the conditions under which work may be resumed. In instances, however, where
the Chief Building Officer finds that immediate action is necessary for public
safety or the public interest, he or she may require that work be stopped upon
verbal order pending issuance of the written notice.
(Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.15 APPEALS.
   Any person aggrieved by any order, requirement, determination, or any other
action or inaction by the Village of Glenwillow in relation to this regulation
may appeal to the court of common pleas. Such an appeal shall be made in
conformity with Ohio R.C. 2506. Written notice of appeal shall be served to the
Village of Glenwillow.
   (a)   Appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals: The Board of Zoning Appeals may
grant a variance to the regulations contained in this Regulation as provided
herein. In granting a variance under this Regulation, the Board of Zoning
Appeals, for good cause, may impose such conditions that it deems appropriate
to maintain the purposes of this Regulation.
   (b)   Procedures for Variances and Appeals: Any owner seeking a variance to
the conditions imposed under this Regulation or an appeal to an administrative
decision made under this Regulation, other than a decision by the Board of
Zoning Appeals, may apply to or appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals. The
following conditions shall apply:
      (1)   When filing an application for an appeal to the Board of Zoning
Appeals from any orders, decisions, and determinations by the Safety Director,
Building Inspector, Village Engineer and any other Village administrative
officer, board or commission, with respect to the application or enforcement of
the provisions contained in this Regulation, the owner shall file a notice of
appeal specifying the grounds therefore with the Building Department within ten
(10) days of the Safety Director's, Building Inspector's, Village Engineer's or
any other Village administrative officer, board or commission's order, decision
or determination. Upon determining that the application is complete and upon
receipt of the required fee as provided by Village Council for appeals to the
Board of Zoning Appeals, the Building Department shall transmit to the Board of
Zoning Appeals the application and a transcript constituting the record from
which the order, decision or determination subject to appeal was based. This
matter shall be placed before the Board of Zoning Appeals and heard in
accordance with the provisions contained in Chapter
1117 of the Codified Ordinances of the Village of Glenwillow.
      (2)   Applications for appeals or variances made under these regulations
shall contain the following information:
         A.   The name, address, and telephone number of the owner.
         B.   Proof of ownership or authorization to represent the owner of the
site.
         C.   The location of the site, including street address and permanent
parcel number.
         D.   A description of the administrative order, decision, or
determination being appealed or the conditions of the regulation from which a
variance is sought.
         E.   Applications for variances or appeals of administrative orders,
decisions, or determinations shall not be resubmitted to the Board of Zoning
Appeals unless, prior to the decision being made by the Board of Zoning
Appeals, the owner shows the Board of Zoning Appeals newly discovered evidence
that could not have been presented with the original submission. The Board of
Zoning Appeals may, at its sole and complete discretion, re- hear an appeal
only if it finds specific evidence of a substantial change in circumstances of
the same property has occurred since the time of the original submission.
         F.   All other procedures for the hearing and deciding of applications
for variances or appeals not covered by this Section shall be in accordance
with the provisions contained in Chapter
1117 of the Codified Ordinances of the Village of Glenwillow.
         G.   A decision by the Board of Zoning Appeals in response to an
application for a variance request or an appeal of an administrative order,
decision or determination filed pursuant to this Regulation shall be final.
            (Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
1192.99 PENALTY.
   Penalties to comply with the items listed in this section or follow the
regulations listed here have the enforcement and penalties actions of the
Village of Glenwillow codified ordinances per Title One of Chapter
1125.
   (a)   Any person, firm, entity or corporation; including but not limited to,
the owner of the property, his agents and assigns, occupant, property manager,
and any contractor or subcontractor who violates or fails to comply with any
provision of this regulation is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree and
shall be fined no more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned for no
more than sixty (60) days, or both, for each offense. A separate offense shall
be deemed committed each day during or on which a violation or noncompliance
occurs or continues.
   (b)   The imposition of any other penalties provided herein shall not
preclude the Village of Glenwillow instituting an appropriate action or
proceeding in a Court of proper jurisdiction to prevent an unlawful
development, or to restrain, correct, or abate a violation, or to require
compliance with the provisions of this regulation or other applicable laws,
ordinances, rules, or regulations, or the orders of the Village of Glenwillow.
   (c)   All expenses incurred by the Village to initiate an enforcement
action, implement a mitigating event, remediate damages caused or resolve a
violation shall be the responsibility of the owner and shall be deducted from
any funds or bonds on file with the Finance Department.
      (Ord. 2024-10-31. Passed 12-4-24.)
CHAPTER 1193
Illicit Discharge and Illegal Connection Control
1193.01   Purpose and scope.
1193.02   Applicability.

Comprehensive Storm Water Management - see P. & Z. Ch.
1191
Erosion and Sediment Control - see P. & Z. Ch.
1192
1193.01 PURPOSE AND SCOPE.
   The purpose of this regulation is to provide for the health, safety, and
general welfare of the residents of the Village of Glenwillow through the
regulation of illicit discharges to the municipal separate storm sewer system
(MS4). This regulation establishes methods for controlling the introduction of
pollutants into the MS4 in order to comply with requirements of the National
Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) permit process as required by
the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency (Ohio EPA).The objectives of this
regulation are:
   (a)   To prohibit illicit discharges and illegal connections to the MS4.
   (b)   To establish legal authority to carry out inspections, monitoring
procedures, and enforcement actions necessary to ensure compliance with this
regulation.
      (Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.02 APPLICABILITY.
   This regulation shall apply to all residential, commercial, industrial, or
institutional facilities responsible for discharges to the MS4 and on any lands
in the Village of Glenwillow, except for those discharges generated by the
activities detailed in Section
1193.07 (a)(1) to (a)(3) of this regulation.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.03 DEFINITIONS.
   The words and terms used in this regulation, unless otherwise expressly
stated, shall have the following meaning:
   (a)   Best Management Practices (BMPs): means schedules of activities,
prohibitions of practices, general good housekeeping practices, pollution
prevention and educational practices, maintenance procedures, and other
management practices to prevent or reduce the discharge of pollutants to storm
water. BMPs also include treatment practices, operating procedures, and
practices to control site runoff, spillage or leaks, sludge or water disposal,
or drainage from raw materials storage.
   (b)   Community: means the Village of Glenwillow, its designated
representatives, boards, or commissions.
   (c)   Environmental Protection Agency or United States Environmental
Protection Agency (USEPA): means the United States Environmental Protection
Agency, including but not limited to the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency
(Ohio EPA), or any duly authorized official of said agency.
   (d)   Floatable Material: in general this term means any foreign matter that
may float or remain suspended in the water column, and includes but is not
limited to, plastic, aluminum cans, wood products, bottles, and paper products.
   (e)   Hazardous Material: means any material including any substance, waste,
or combination thereof, which because of its quantity, concentration, or
physical, chemical, or infectious characteristics may cause, or significantly
contribute to, a substantial present or potential hazard to human health,
safety, property, or the environment when improperly treated, stored,
transported, disposed of, or otherwise managed.
   (f)   Illicit Discharge: as defined at 40 C.F.R. 122.26 (b)(2) means any
discharge to an MS4 that is not composed entirely of storm water, except for
those discharges to an MS4 pursuant to a NPDES permit or noted in Section
1193.07 of this regulation.
   (g)   Illegal Connection: means any drain or conveyance, whether on the
surface or subsurface, that allows an illicit discharge to enter the MS4.
   (h)   Municipal Separate Storm Sewer System (MS4): as defined at 40 C.F.R.
122.26 (b)(8), municipal separate storm sewer system means a conveyance or
system of conveyances (including roads with drainage systems, municipal
streets, catch basins, curbs, gutters, ditches, man-made channels, or storm
drains):
      (1)   Owned or operated by a State, Village, town, borough, county,
parish, district, municipality, township, county, district, association, or
other public body (created by or pursuant to State law) having jurisdiction
over sewage, industrial wastes, including special districts under State law
such as a sewer district, or similar entity, or an Indian tribe or an
authorized Indian tribal organization, or a designated and approved management
agency under section 208 of the Clean Water Act that discharges to waters of
the United States;
      (2)   Designed or used for collecting or conveying storm water;
      (3)   Which is not a combined sewer; and
      (4)   Which is not part of a Publicly Owned Treatment Works (POTW) as
defined at 40 C.F.R. 122.2.
   (i)   National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) Storm Water
Discharge Permit: means a permit issued by EPA (or by a State under authority
delegated pursuant to 33 USC § 1342 (b)) that authorizes the discharge of
pollutants to waters of the United States, whether the permit is applicable on
an individual, group, or general areawide basis.
   (j)   Off-Lot Discharging Home Sewage Treatment System: means a system
designed to treat home sewage on-site and discharges treated wastewater
effluent off the property into a storm water or surface water conveyance or
system.
   (k)   Owner/Operator: means any individual, association, organization,
partnership, firm, corporation or other entity recognized by law and acting as
either the owner or on the owner's behalf.
   (l)   Pollutant: means anything that causes or contributes to pollution.
Pollutants may include, but are not limited to, paints, varnishes, solvents,
oil and other automotive fluids, non-hazardous liquid and solid wastes, yard
wastes, refuse, rubbish, garbage, litter or other discarded or abandoned
objects, floatable materials, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, hazardous
materials, wastes, sewage, dissolved and particulate metals, animal wastes,
residues that result from constructing a structure, and noxious or offensive
matter of any kind.
   (m)   Storm Water: any surface flow, runoff, and drainage consisting
entirely of water from any form of natural precipitation, and resulting from
such precipitation.
   (n)   Wastewater: The spent water of a community from the standpoint of a
source, it may be a combination of the liquid and water-carried wastes from
residences, commercial buildings, industrial plants, and institutions.
      (Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.04 DISCLAIMER OF LIABILITY.
   Compliance with the provisions of this regulation shall not relieve any
person from responsibility for damage to any person otherwise imposed by law.
The provisions of this regulation are promulgated to promote the health,
safety, and welfare of the public and are not designed for the benefit of any
individual or for the benefit of any particular parcel of property.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.05 CONFLICTS, SEVERABILITY, NUISANCES AND RESPONSIBILITY.
   (a)   Where this regulation is in conflict with other provisions of law or
ordinance, the most restrictive provisions, as determined by the Village of
Glenwillow, shall prevail.
   (b)   If any clause, section, or provision of this regulation is declared
invalid or unconstitutional by a court of competent jurisdiction, the validity
of the remainder shall not be affected thereby.
   (c)   This regulation shall not be construed as authorizing any person to
maintain a nuisance on their property, and compliance with the provisions of
this regulation shall not be a defense in any action to abate such a nuisance.
   (d)   Failure of the Village of Glenwillow to observe or recognize hazardous
or unsightly conditions or to recommend corrective measures shall not relieve
the site owner from the responsibility for the condition or damage resulting
there from, and shall not result in the Village of Glenwillow, its officers,
employees, or agents being responsible for any condition or damage resulting
therefrom.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.06 RESPONSIBILITY FOR ADMINISTRATION.
   The Village of Glenwillow shall administer, implement, and enforce the
provisions of this regulation. The Village of Glenwillow may contract with the
Cuyahoga County Board of Health to conduct inspections and monitoring and to
assist with enforcement actions.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.07 DISCHARGE AND CONNECTION PROHIBITIONS.
   (a)   Prohibition of Illicit Discharges. No person shall discharge, or cause
to be discharged, an illicit discharge into the MS4. The commencement, conduct,
or continuance of any illicit discharge to the MS4 is prohibited except as
described below:
      (1)   Water line flushing; landscape irrigation; diverted stream flows;
rising ground waters; uncontaminated ground water infiltration; uncontaminated
pumped ground water; discharges from potable water sources; foundation drains;
air conditioning condensate; irrigation water; springs; water from crawl space
pumps; footing drains; lawn watering; individual residential car washing;
charity car washes; flows from riparian habitats and wetlands; dechlorinated
swimming pool discharges; street wash water; and discharges or flows from
firefighting activities. These discharges are exempt until such time as they
are determined by the Village of Glenwillow to be significant contributors of
pollutants to the MS4.
      (2)   Discharges specified in writing by the Village of Glenwillow as
being necessary to protect public health and safety.
      (3)   Discharges from off-lot discharging home sewage treatment systems
permitted by the Cuyahoga County Board of Health for the purpose of discharging
treated sewage effluent in accordance with Ohio Administrative Code 3701-29-02
(6) until such time as the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency issues an NPDES
permitting mechanism for residential one (1), two (2), or three (3) family
dwellings. These discharges are exempt unless such discharges are deemed to be
creating a public health nuisance by the Cuyahoga County Board of Health.
In compliance with the Village of Glenwillow Storm Water Management Program,
discharges from all off-lot discharging home sewage treatment systems must
either be eliminated or have coverage under an appropriate NPDES permit issued
and approved by the Ohio Environmental Protection Agency. When such permit
coverage is available, discharges from off-lot discharging home sewage
treatment systems will no longer be exempt from the requirements of this
regulation.
   (b)   Prohibition of Illegal Connections. The construction, use,
maintenance, or continued existence of illegal connections to the MS4 is
prohibited.
      (1)   This prohibition expressly includes, without limitation, illegal
connections made in the past, regardless of whether the connection was
permissible under law or practices applicable or prevailing at the time of
connection.
      (2)   A person is considered to be in violation of this regulation if the
person connects a line conveying illicit discharges to the MS4, or allows such
a connection to continue.
         (Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.08 MONITORING OF ILLICIT DISCHARGES AND ILLEGAL CONNECTIONS.
   (a)   Establishment of an Illicit Discharge and Illegal Connection
Monitoring Program: The Village of Glenwillow shall establish a program to
detect and eliminate illicit discharges and illegal connections to the MS4.
This program shall include the mapping of the MS4, including MS4 outfalls; the
routine inspection of storm water outfalls to the MS4, and the systematic
investigation of potential residential, commercial, industrial, and
institutional facilities for the sources of any dry weather flows found as the
result of these inspections.
   (b)   Inspection of Residential, Commercial, Industrial, or Institutional
Facilities.
      (1)   The Village of Glenwillow shall be permitted to enter and inspect
facilities subject to this regulation as often as may be necessary to determine
compliance with this regulation.
      (2)   The Village of Glenwillow shall have the right to set up at
facilities subject to this regulation such devices as are necessary to conduct
monitoring and/or sampling of the facility's storm water discharge, as
determined by the Village of Glenwillow.
      (3)   The Village of Glenwillow shall have the right to require the
facility owner/operator to install monitoring equipment as necessary. This
sampling and monitoring equipment shall be maintained at all times in safe and
proper operating condition by the facility owner/operator at the owner/
operator's expense. All devices used to measure storm water flow and quality
shall be calibrated by the Village of Glenwillow to ensure their accuracy.
      (4)   Any temporary or permanent obstruction to safe and reasonable
access to the facility to be inspected and/or sampled shall be promptly removed
by the facility's owner/operator at the written or oral request of the Village
of Glenwillow and shall not be replaced. The costs of clearing such access
shall be borne by the facility owner/operator.
      (5)   Unreasonable delays in allowing the Village of Glenwillow access to
a facility subject to this regulation for the purposes of illicit discharge
inspection is a violation of this regulation.
      (6)   If the Village of Glenwillow is refused access to any part of the
facility from which storm water is discharged, and the Village of Glenwillow
demonstrates probable cause to believe that there may be a violation of this
regulation, or that there is a need to inspect and/or sample as part of an
inspection and sampling program designed to verify compliance with this
regulation or any order issued hereunder, or to protect the public health,
safety, and welfare, the Village of Glenwillow may seek issuance of a search
warrant, civil remedies including but not limited to injunctive relief, and/or
criminal remedies from any court of appropriate jurisdiction.
      (7)   Upon confirmation of an illicit discharge from a facility by the
Village of Glenwillow, any costs associated with the review of proposed
remediation plans, inspecting the facility to determine compliance with this
regulation, and monitoring and/or sampling of the facility's storm water
discharge, throughout the time period it takes to adequately resolve the
illicit discharge, shall be assessed to the facility owner/operator.
         (Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.09 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   Notice of Violation. When the Village of Glenwillow finds that a
person has violated a prohibition or failed to meet a requirement of this
regulation, the Village of Glenwillow may order compliance by written Notice of
Violation. Such notice must specify the violation and shall be hand delivered,
and/or sent by registered mail, to the owner/operator of the facility. Such
notice may require the following actions:
      (1)   The performance of monitoring, analyses, and reporting;
      (2)   The elimination of illicit discharges or illegal connections;
      (3)   That violating discharges, practices, or operations cease and
desist;
      (4)   The abatement or remediation of storm water pollution or
contamination hazards and the restoration of any affected property; or
      (5)   The implementation of source control or treatment BMPs.
   (b)   If abatement of a violation and/or restoration of affected property is
required, the Notice of Violation shall set forth a deadline within which such
remediation or restoration must be completed. Said Notice shall further advise
that, should the facility owner/operator fail to remediate or restore within
the established deadline, a legal action for enforcement may be initiated.
   (c)   Any person receiving a Notice of Violation must meet compliance
standards within the time established in the Notice of Violation.
   (d)   Administrative Hearing: If the violation has not been corrected
pursuant to the requirements set forth in the Notice of Violation, the Village
of Glenwillow shall schedule an administrative hearing to determine reasons for
non-compliance and to determine the next enforcement activity. Notice of the
administrative hearing shall be hand delivered and/or sent registered mail.
   The Administrative Hearing shall be conducted by the Village Engineer. Any
decisions of the Village Engineer may be appealed to the Planning Commission as
provided in Section
1119.01.
   (e)   Injunctive Relief: It shall be unlawful for any owner/operator to
violate any provision or fail to comply with any of the requirements of this
regulation pursuant to Ohio R.C. 3709.211. If an owner/operator has violated or
continues to violate the provisions of this regulation, the Village of
Glenwillow may petition for a preliminary or permanent injunction restraining
the owner/operator from activities that would create further violations or
compelling the owner/operator to perform abatement or remediation of the
violation.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.10 REMEDIES NOT EXCLUSIVE.
   The remedies listed in this regulation are not exclusive of any other
remedies available under any applicable federal, state or local law and it is
in the discretion of the Village of Glenwillow to seek cumulative remedies.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)
1193.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Any person, firm, entity or corporation; including but not limited to,
the owner and or operator of the property, his agents and assigns, occupant,
property manager, and any contractor or subcontractor who violates or fails to
comply with any provision of this regulation is guilty of a misdemeanor of the
third degree and shall be fined no more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or
imprisoned for no more than sixty (60) days, or both, for each offense. A
separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on which a
violation or noncompliance occurs or continues beyond the date established in
the Notice of Violation set forth in Section
1193.09.
   (b)   All expenses incurred by the Village of Glenwillow to initiate an
enforcement action, implement a mitigating event, remediation of damages caused
or resolve a violation shall be the responsibility of the property owner and/or
operator.
(Ord. 2016-07-24. Passed 8-3-16.)

1301.01 ADOPTION.
   There is hereby adopted by the Village of Glenwillow the 2011 Ohio Building
Code (OBC), as adopted by the Ohio Board of Building Standards, Department of
Industrial Compliance and as published in Division 4101:1 of the Ohio
Administrative Code (OAC) and such adoption shall have the same effect as if
the entire Ohio Building Code were set forth at length herein.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.02 PURPOSE.
   The purpose of the Ohio Building Code as adopted herein is to:
   (a)   Provide uniform standards and requirements for the erection,
construction, repair, alteration and maintenance of buildings, including
construction of industrialized units. Such standards shall relate to the
conservation of energy, safety and sanitation of buildings for their intended
use and occupancy.
   (b)   Formulate such standards and requirements, so far as is practicable,
in terms of performance objectives, so as to make adequate performance for the
use intended the test of acceptability.
   (c)   Permit to the fullest extent feasible, the use of materials and
technical methods, devices and improvements, including the use of
industrialized units which tend to reduce the cost of construction and erection
without affecting minimum requirements for the health, safety and security of
the occupants or users of buildings or industrialized units and without
preferential treatment of types or classes of materials or products or methods
of construction.
   (d)   Encourage, so far as may be practicable, the standardization of
construction practices, methods, equipment, material and techniques, including
methods employed to produce industrialized units.
      (Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.03 APPLICATION.
   The Ohio Building Code as adopted herein applies to all buildings except as
follows:
   (a)   Single-family, two-family and three-family dwelling houses which are
not constructed of industrialized units, except where the context specifies
mandatory applicability;
   (b)   Buildings owned by and used for a function of the United States
government;
   (c)   Existing buildings where their location, parts, equipment and other
items do not constitute a serious hazard;
   (d)   Buildings constructed in accordance with plans which have been
approved prior to the effective date of the Ohio Building Code adoption;
   (e)   Buildings or structures which are incident to the use for agricultural
purposes of the land on which such buildings or structures are located,
provided such buildings or structures are not used in the business of retail
trade, as set forth in Ohio R.C. 3781.06.
      (Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.04 COMPLIANCE.
   (a)   No owner or any other person shall construct, erect, build or equip
any buildings or structure to which the Ohio Building Code is applicable, or
make any addition thereto or alteration thereof, except in case of repairs for
maintenance without affecting the construction, sanitation, safety or other
vital features of such building or structure, without complying with this
chapter, Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 or the Ohio Building Code, or fail to
comply with any lawful order issued pursuant thereto.
   (b)   No architect, building, engineer, plumber, carpenter, mason,
contractor, subcontractor, foreman or employee shall violate or assist in
violating this chapter, Ohio R.C. Chapters 3781 and 3791 or the Ohio Building
Code, or fail to comply with any lawful order issued pursuant thereto.
   (c)   No owner or any other person shall proceed with the construction,
erection, alteration or equipment of any building or structure to which the
Ohio Building Code is applicable without complying with this chapter and the
plan and specification submission and processing requirements of the Village of
Glenwillow, and until plans or drawings, specifications and data have been
approved, or the industrialized unit has been inspected at the point of origin.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.05 USE AND MAINTENANCE.
   (a)   New Work. No buildings or its equipment or appurtenances, to which the
Ohio Building Code is applicable under Section
1301.03 shall be erected, constructed or installed, except in conformity with
OBC.
   (b)   Change of Use. The use of a building shall not be changed, as defined
in the Ohio Building Code, unless or until the building and the building
service equipment therein conforms to the requirements of OBC for buildings of
the proposed new use group classification and zoning requirements of the
Village.
   (c)   Alterations. No building, or building service equipment therein, shall
be so altered, as to be less safe or sanitary that it was before being altered,
unless when altered, such building and equipment conforms to the applicable
provisions of OBC.
   (d)   Maintenance. Buildings and building service equipment shall be
maintained so as to comply with OBC, except that when a serious hazard does not
exist, no change in construction and no additional facilities are required
except as may be made necessary by a change of occupancy under subsection (b)
thereof.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.06 ADMINISTRATION.
   There is hereby established a Department of Commercial and Industrial
Buildings staffed by such personnel and with the duties and at the rates of
compensation as hereinafter respectively provided.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.07 INSPECTOR OF COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL BUILDINGS.
   (a)   There is hereby created the position of Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings.
   (b)   The duties of the Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings
shall be fulfilled by the Village Chief Building Official.
   (c)   It shall be the duty of the Inspector of Commercial and Industrial
Buildings, himself and by and through his own personnel and employees, and
pursuant to the requirements and standards as established from time to time by
appropriate ordinances, statutes, or regulations, to examine and approve or
disapprove, and to require such alterations, additions and amendments thereto
as required by ordinances, statutes or regulations, of all plans and
specifications for proposed commercial and industrial buildings, structures,
and uses in the Village and to see to the enforcement of all ordinances and
statutes and regulatory provisions relating to such buildings, structures, and
uses and zoning; and to inspect all such buildings, structures, and uses being
erected, altered or repaired, as frequently as may be necessary to insure
compliance with the appropriate ordinances, statutes or regulations; and to
advise and consult with, upon request, the other personnel of the Department as
hereinafter provided, and the other Village officials.
   (d)   The Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings shall have the
power to order all work stopped on construction or alteration or repair of
commercial and industrial buildings and structures in the Village, when such
work is being done in violation of any provision of any ordinance, statute or
regulations relating thereto, or in violation of the Zoning Ordinance. Work
shall not be resumed after the issuance of such an order except on the written
permission of the Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings, provided
that if the stop order is an oral one, the practice shall be to follow it with
a written stop order within a day's time delivered to the one against whom it
is directed, or left upon the premises. Such written stop order may be served
by any Village policeman.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.08 PLUMBING INSPECTOR.
   (a)   There is hereby created the position of Plumbing Inspector of
Commercial and Industrial Buildings, the position to be filled by appointment
by the Mayor, with the consent of Council. The appointee shall serve at the
pleasure of the Mayor.
   (b)   It shall be the duty of the Plumbing Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings, pursuant to the requirements and standards as established
from time to time by appropriate ordinances, statutes or regulations, to see to
the enforcement of all provisions thereof relating to plumbing, heating and air
conditioning, and plumbing and heating and air conditioning equipment; and to
make such inspections and perform such tests as may be necessary, and as
frequently as may be necessary, in the enforcement thereof.
   (c)   The Plumbing Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings shall
have the power to order all work stopped on the construction, alteration, or
repair of plumbing, heating and air conditioning and plumbing and heating and
air conditioning equipment when such work is being done in violation of any
provision of any ordinance, statute or regulation relating thereto. Work shall
not be resumed after the issuance of such a stop order except on written
permission of the Plumbing Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings,
provided that if the stop order is an oral one, the practice shall be to follow
it with a written stop order within a day's time delivered to the one against
whom it is directed, or left upon the premises. Such written stop order may be
served by any Village policeman.
   (d)   The compensation for the Plumbing Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings shall be set forth in the resolution of appointment to
such office.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.09 ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR.
   (a)   There is hereby created the position of Electrical Inspector of
Commercial and Industrial Buildings, the position to be filled by appointment
by the Mayor, with the consent of Council. The appointee shall serve at the
pleasure of the Mayor.
   (b)   It shall be the duty of the Electrical Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings, pursuant to the requirements and standards as established
from time to time by appropriate ordinances, statutes, or regulations, to see
to the enforcement of all provisions thereof relating to electricity and
electrical equipment; and to make such inspections and perform such tests as
may be necessary, and as frequently as may be necessary, in the enforcement
thereof.
   (c)   The Electrical Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings shall
have the power to order all work stopped on the construction, alteration, or
repair of electrical matters or electrical equipment when such work is being
done in violation of any provision of any ordinance, statute, or regulation
relating thereto. Work shall not be resumed after the issuance of such a stop
order except on written permission of the Electrical Inspector of Commercial
and Industrial Buildings, provided that if the stop order is an oral one, the
practice shall be to follow it with a written stop order within a day's time
delivered to the one against whom it is directed, or left upon the premises.
Such written stop order may be served by any Village policeman.
   (d)   The compensation for the Electrical Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings shall be set forth in the resolution of appointment to
such office.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.10 COORDINATING INSPECTOR.
   (a)   There is hereby created the position of Coordinating Inspector of
Commercial and Industrial Buildings.
   (b)   The Coordinating Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings
shall be the Inspector of Buildings.
   (c)   It shall be the duty of the Coordinating Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings to coordinate the functions and activities of, and to act
as liaison between and among the other Inspectors herein provided, and the
persons, firms, or corporations seeking information, aid, advice, permits, and
inspections; to issue permits and collect proper fees therefor, upon the
written directions and computations of the other Inspectors herein provided;
forthwith to pay over all fees collected to the Finance Director; when
knowledge thereof comes to him, to inform the other Inspectors herein provided
of any construction, alteration, or repairs being made or done in the Village
within their respective fields, and of any violations of which they should be
informed; and when requested by any other Inspector herein provided, to serve
stop orders issued by them.
   (d)   The compensation for the Coordinating Inspector of Commercial and
Industrial Buildings shall be set forth in the resolution of appointment to
such office.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.11 PERMITS, FEES AND DEPOSITS.
   (a)   Permits Required. No construction of or additions, alterations, or
repairs to any premises or building or structure thereon or appurtenances
thereof shall be commenced or continued until and unless a permit therefor has
been applied for and issued, and the fees therefor, as prescribed herein, are
paid in full to the Village. However, should a Homeowners' Association (HOA)
have a restriction on any residential parcel of land that has not been
invalidated by an order of a court of competent jurisdiction, no building
permit may be applied for until the applicant submits the written approval of
the Homeowners' Association to the Inspector of Buildings.
   (b)   Permit Application. An application for a building permit shall be
signed by the owner or his authorized agent and shall be filed with the Chief
Building Official on a form furnished by the Glenwillow Building Department.
   (c)   Submission of Plans and Specifications.  An application for a building
permit shall be accompanied by the plans and specifications required by the OBC
or the RCO, with specifications either on drawings or as a separate document.
In addition to the requirements established in the OBC and the RCO, the plans
shall contain the name and address of the owner, the person who prepared them,
and an estimated completion time.
   (d)   Fees. The fees prescribed in this section shall be additive and
separate fees shall be paid for each of the items listed. The following fees
and deposits shall be charged for all building and zoning applications and
permits pursuant to the ordinances of the Village.

      (1)   Approval.  If the Chief Building Official is satisfied that the
work described in an application for a permit and the plans and specifications
filed therewith conform to and comply with the requirements of the
Architectural Board of Review, this Building Code, the Zoning Code, and other
pertinent laws and ordinances, and upon payment of the required fee, he shall
issue or authorize the issuance of a building permit.
      (2)   Disapproval. If the application for a building permit and the plans
and specifications filed therewith describe work which does not conform to the
requirements of this Building Code or other pertinent laws or ordinances, or
does not contain sufficient information, the Chief Building Official shall not
issue a permit but shall return the plans and specifications to the applicant
with his refusal to issue such permit. The Chief Building Official shall give
in writing such reasons for rejection.
   (g)   Intentionally omitted.
   (h)   Fees for Professional Services. In addition to any other fees or
deposits required by this or any other section of the Codified Ordinances, the
Chief Building Official shall charge and collect a fee in an amount as
determined by the Chief Building Official relative to the professional service
required. This fee is to reimburse the Village for expenses incurred for
architectural, engineering, legal or other professional services rendered as a
result of the filing of an application or investigation for a building permit
and a review of the building plans submitted therewith or inspection/report as
required. All charges to applicants for professional services of the Village
Architect, Village Engineer or Village Law Director shall be at the rates set
forth in their contracts with the Village as evidenced by statements of the
respective professionals at the conclusion of their review. In the event that
the Chief Building Official determines that the monies collected by an
applicant are depleted, then the applicant shall be required to pay additional
monies to re-establish the fund as determined by the scope of the proposed
work.
   (i)   Intentionally omitted.

1301.12 RIGHT OF ENTRY.
   The Inspector of Commercial and Industrial Buildings, Plumbing Inspector,
Electrical Inspector, and Coordinating Inspector, and their deputies,
assistants or employees assigned by them or persons assigned to cooperate with
them by other departments of the Village, so far as may be necessary for the
performance of their duties, shall have the right to enter upon any building
site or premises, or any new or unoccupied building or any building under
construction, repair, alteration, removal or any building alleged to be unsafe
or a menace to life or limb, or damaged or menaced by fire, upon showing proper
identification.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.13 NOTICE OF VIOLATIONS; ADJUDICATION OR STOP WORK ORDER.
   (a)   When the Village finds that work or equipment is contrary to this
chapter's approved plans therefor, or the Ohio Building Code, statutes or
regulations relating thereto, notice in writing shall be sent or delivered to
the owner of such building or structure or his agent. The notice shall state
where and in what respect the work or equipment does not conform to such lawful
requirements and specify a reasonable period of time in which to conform. Work
shall not be resumed after the issuance of such an order except with written
permission of the Inspector or other Village official issuing the order.
   (b)   Prior to enforcement of this chapter by any civil or criminal remedy,
the Village chapter shall issue an adjudication order within the meaning of
Ohio R.C. 119.06 to 119.13 and Ohio Administrative Code 4101:2-1-35, or a stop
work order as provided in OAC 4101:2-1-36. Failure to cease work after receipt
of an adjudication order is a violation of this chapter pending completion of
appeal as provided in Ohio R.C. 3781.19, and failure to cease work after
receipt of a stop work order is a violation of this chapter and is hereby
declared a public nuisance pending completion of appeal as provided in Ohio
R.C. 3781.19.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.14 COPIES.
   Copies of Codes as adopted in this chapter are on file with the Council
Clerk for inspection of the public, and also on file in the County Law Library,
and the Clerk has copies available for distribution to the public at cost.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.15 CONFLICT.
   (a)   The Ohio Building Code shall supersede and govern any order, standard,
rule or regulation of the Ohio Fire Code or the Division of State Fire Marshal,
Department of Commerce in all cases where such orders, standards, rules or
regulations are in conflict with the Ohio Building Code.
   (b)   In all other cases of conflict between the Ohio Building Code and any
other Village ordinance or technical code adopted thereby, the more restrictive
provision shall govern.
   (c)   Where a special provision is made in a use group classification of OBC
and is inconsistent with a general provision of OBC relating to buildings
generally, the special provision governs, unless it appears that the provisions
are cumulative.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1301.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter or any Code adopted herein or
fails to comply with any lawful order issued pursuant thereto is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the first degree and shall be fined not more than one thousand
dollars ($1,000) or imprisoned not more than six (6) months or both. Each day
during which noncompliance or a violation continues shall constitute a separate
offense. The Village may institute injunction proceedings in Common Pleas Court
to abate the nuisance of failure to cease work after receipt of a stop work
order as referred to in Section
1301.13(b).
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)

CHAPTER 1304
National Electrical Code
1304.01   Adoption.
1304.02   File copy.
1304.03   Enforcement.
1304.04   Conflict.
1304.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Adoption of technical codes by reference -see Ohio R.C. 731.231
1304.01 ADOPTION.
   There is hereby adopted by the Village for the purpose of establishing rules
and regulations for the installation and maintenance of electrical materials in
dwelling units consisting of one, two or three families, the National
Electrical Code, recommended by the National Fire Protection Association;
particularly the 2008 Edition. The National Electrical Code is hereby adopted
and incorporated in its entirety, as if fully set out at length herein, and
from the date on which this section shall take effect, the provisions thereof
shall be controlling in the installation and maintenance of all electrical
materials in one, two or three family dwelling units contained within the
corporate limits of the Village.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1304.02 FILE COPY.
   A complete copy of the 2008 Edition of the National Electrical Code shall be
maintained in the possession of the Village Building Department for public
reference.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1304.03 ENFORCEMENT.
   The Village Chief Building Official shall enforce the National Electrical
Code as adopted hereby.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1304.04 CONFLICT.
   In all cases of conflict between the National Electrical Code and other
existing ordinances or technical codes adopted by the Village, the more
stringent provisions shall govern.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1304.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter or any code adopted herein or
fails to comply with any lawful order issued pursuant thereto is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the first degree. Each day such violation occurs or continues
shall constitute a separate offense. Nothing herein shall prevent the Village
from taking such other lawful action as is necessary to prevent or remedy any
violation.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
CHAPTER 1305
Numbering Structures
1305.01   System adopted.
1305.02   Map.
1305.03   Dedication.
1305.04   Placement of residential addresses.
1305.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate building numbering - see Ohio R. C. 715.26
1305.01 SYSTEM ADOPTED.
   (a)   Council hereby does require and regulate the numbering and renumbering
of buildings in the Village and adopts the method hereinafter provided to
accomplish such purpose.
   (b)   For the purposes of this chapter Richmond Road and Cochran Road shall
be considered north and south streets and Pettibone Road and Pergl Road east
and west streets.
   (c)   All numbers of buildings, erected or hereafter erected, and located on
the east sides of Richmond Road and Cochran Road shall be so numbered as to end
with an odd number; that all numbers of buildings erected or hereafter erected
and located on the west side of Cochran Road shall be so numbered as to end
with an even number; that all numbers of buildings erected or hereafter erected
and located on the north sides of Pettibone Road and of Pergl Road shall be so
numbered as to end with an odd number, and those on the south sides of such
streets shall be so numbered as to end with an even number.
   (d)   Such numbers on the east side of Richmond Road shall start with 6605
at the north at the Solon-Glenwillow boundary, and end on the side with the
number 7685 at the Village southerly boundary. Numbers between such termini
shall be consecutive and spaced ten numbers per every 100 front foot unit of
space.
   (e)   Such numbers on the east side of Cochran Road shall start with 6605 at
the north at the Solon-Glenwillow boundary and proceed therefrom southerly on
the east side of Cochran Road in consecutive increasing numbers and spaced ten
numbers per every 100 front foot unit of space. The numbers on the west side of
Cochran Road shall start with 6606 at the north at the Solon-Glenwillow
boundary and proceed therefrom southerly on the west side of Cochran Road in
consecutive increasing numbers and spaced ten numbers per every 100 front foot
unit of space.
   (f)   Such numbers on the north side of Pettibone Road shall start with
27051 at the intersection of Richmond Road and proceed therefrom easterly on
the north side of Pettibone Road in consecutive increasing numbers and spaced
fifty numbers per every 110 front foot unit of space. The numbers on the south
side of Pettibone Road shall start with 27050 at the intersection of Richmond
Road and end on the side with the number 32190 at the Solon-Glenwillow
boundary. Numbers on the south side between such termini shall be consecutive
and spaced fifty numbers per every 110 front foot unit of space.
   (g)   The numbers on the north side of Pergl Road shall start with 27051 at
the intersection of Richmond Road and proceed therefrom easterly on the north
side of Pergl Road in consecutive increasing numbers and spaced fifty numbers
per every 110 front foot unit of space. The numbers on the south side of Pergl
Road shall start with 27050 at the intersection of Richmond Road and proceed
therefrom easterly on the south side of Pergl Road in consecutive increasing
numbers and spaced fifty (50) numbers per every 110 front foot unit of space.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1305.02 MAP.
   The Mayor and the Chief Building Official are directed to prepare a map or
sketch in accordance with this chapter as an aid to compliance with the terms
of this chapter by owners and occupiers of buildings subject to the provisions
hereof.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1305.03 DEDICATION.
   This chapter is not and shall not be deemed or construed to be an acceptance
of dedication of any street, nor to impose any responsibility or duty on the
Village to maintain, repair, alter, or construct any street, nor to require the
Village to furnish or supply any other service or perform any other act to or
for any owner, occupier, resident, visitor, or building.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1305.04 PLACEMENT OF RESIDENTIAL ADDRESSES.
   Street numbers for all new residential construction shall be of at least
three (3) inches in height and shall be permanently carved, chiseled or cast
into a hard masonry material such as stone or on a plate of metal such as
bronze and permanently mortared into place on the front of the building in a
prominent place such that it may be viewed from the street.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1305.99 PENALTY.
   Any owner or occupier of a building in the Village who violates any
provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor and each day
of any such violation shall be considered a separate and distinct offense.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
CHAPTER 1310
Landscape Plan
1310.01   Landscaping required.
1310.01 LANDSCAPING REQUIRED.
   An application for a Building Permit for construction of a new residential
dwelling pursuant to
1301.11 shall be accompanied by a landscape plan for those portions of the lot
which will be deforested. The landscape plan shall contain the following
requirements and shall be incorporated as a part of the building permit:
   (a)   Lawn and Other New Landscaping.
      (1)   The minimum new landscaping to be installed upon the deforested
portion of the lot shall be for either a sod lawn or a lawn seeded for an
appropriate type of grass in a sufficient base of topsoil to allow proper
rooting.
      (2)   For new construction on a lot in a subdivision for which a master
residential landscaping plan has been adopted as part of the approval for the
subdivision, the landscape plan for the new dwelling shall comply with the
specifications of such master landscaping plan, such as but not limited to
minimum quantity, size at planting and placement of plant materials.
      (3)   Street trees required in Section
1172.12 of a type and size as established in the approval for the subdivision
shall be included in the landscape plan if the required street tree(s) has not
already installed at the time the application for a building permit for new
construction of a residential dwelling is submitted.
      (4)   Additional landscaping beyond the minimum required in this section
is encouraged in order to ensure the newly developed lot is compatible with the
existing character of the neighborhood in which the lot is located.
      (5)   The plan shall acknowledge that all temporary construction drainage
and silt controls will remain in place and be maintained until the landscape
plan has been carried out.
   (b)   Builder to Install Lawn. Every builder who obtains a building permit
for the construction of a new residential dwelling shall on the face of the
permit sign an agreement that within thirty (30) days of completion of the home
and installation of a driveway to the required garage he/she shall provide the
sod lawn or planted lawn and the street tree specified in subsection (a) above
and to fail to do so shall be a violation of this ordinance.
   (c)   Cash Deposits to Guarantee Installation of Lawns and Landscaping. A
cash deposit of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) shall be deposited with the
Village of Glenwillow for landscaping and lawn installation. Said deposit will
be returned to the applicant if the lawn is properly installed, landscaping is
completed and the lawn has been installed and eighty percent (80%) growth as
determined by the Inspector of Buildings, within the required time frame. If
the lawn and landscaping is not planted as required, the Village may, in its
sole discretion, use the cash deposit to hire a private landscaper to finish
grade, place topsoil, seed, mulch, landscape and water, as necessary, up to a
total cost not to exceed the full amount of applicant’s deposit.
   (d)   Penalty. Whoever violates Section
1310.01 shall be guilty of a first degree misdemeanor and upon conviction
thereof be fined not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000) nor imprisoned for
more than 180 days or both. Each day such violation or failure to comply shall
exist shall constitute a separate offense.
      (Ord. 2023-09-29. Passed 12-6-23.)
CHAPTER 1313
High Voltage Towers
1313.01   Permit required.
1313.02   Lines less than 33 KV.
1313.03   Lines greater than 33 KV.
1313.04   Maintenance of environment.
1313.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate electricity equipment - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
Consent for electrical fixtures and lines on public property - see Ohio R.C.
715.27, 4933.13, 4933.16
1313.01 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person, firm or corporation shall erect or construct, or cause to be
erected or constructed, any wire, transmission power line, pole, tower or other
equipment for the distribution or transmission of electricity through the
streets, alleys, lanes, lands, squares, or public places of the Village without
first having obtained a permit therefor form Council, as hereinafter provided.
No charge shall be made for such permit.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1313.02 LINES LESS THAN 33 KV.
   Where the voltage to be carried by such wire or transmission power line is
equal to or not in excess of 33 KV, and additional supporting structures are
not required for such purpose, Council may issue such permit upon written
request therefor, subject to the Charter and terms and conditions of all
ordinances of the Village pertaining to any franchise rights of the applicant
for such permit, and subject to the regulatory powers granted to the Village by
the laws of the State in such cases made and provided.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1313.03 LINES GREATER THAN 33 KV.
   (a)   Where the voltage to be carried by such transmission power line is in
excess of 33 KV, or where additional supporting structures are required for any
purpose, the applicant for such permit shall first file with the Planning
Commission of the Village detailed plans and specifications in support of the
request for such permit, which plans and specifications shall show the course
and route of both the existing and proposed transmission power lines and
clearly designated center lines of the rights-of-way thereof, in and through
the Village. The Planning Commission shall then hold a public hearing on the
application in conformity with the Charter of the Village and report its
findings and recommendations to Council who may issue a permit for such
construction or alteration in a form as approved by Council. Such permit shall
be subject to the Charter, and the terms and conditions of all ordinances of
the Village to any franchise rights of the applicant for such permit, and
subject to the regulatory powers granted to the Village by the laws of the
State in such cases made and provided.
   (b)   Future construction or installation of electrical transmission power
lines in or through the Village, carrying voltage in excess of 33 KV, shall be
installed either:
      (1)   By altering, increasing or expanding the then existing overhead
line or lines, using the then existing supporting structures on the then
existing rights-of-way;
      (2)   By construction of new supporting structures on land immediately
adjacent to any then existing right-of-way for any 33 KV or greater
transmission line, thereby increasing the width of the existing right-of-way to
accommodate one or more transmission lines parallel with and contiguous to any
then existing 33 KV or greater transmission line; or
      (3)   By underground installation. Any such line or lines installed
underground shall be at a minimum depth of six (6) feet below grade and shall
be backfilled and laid in at least six (6) inches of sand, and shall be
standard underground lead-covered cable or coated and cathodically protected
pipe-type cable, encased in an enclosed, sealed and welded sheath, having a
somatic coating, and such pipe must be oil filled and shall be capable of
withstanding any maintained pressure. Any such underground installation shall
be located not nearer than 500 feet to facilities used for manufacture,
processing, bulk storage, or testing of high explosives, electric blasting
caps, petroleum products or similar such explosive or inflammable commodities.
         (Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1313.04 MAINTENANCE OF ENVIRONMENT.
   Any person, firm or corporation supplying electricity to or through the
Village shall maintain the rights-of-way used for its installation in a
condition and to a degree which is compatible with the surrounding area and the
natural environment.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1313.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
five hundred dollars ($500.00) nor imprisoned for not more than ninety (90)
days, or both. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
CHAPTER 1317
Grade Changes
1317.01   Prohibition of certain grade changes.
1317.02   Permit required.
1317.03   Application for permit.
1317.04   Review of application, inspection, report and certification by
Village Engineer.
1317.05   Prohibited fill material.
1317.06   Maintaining grade lines established by the Village.
1317.99   Penalty.
CROSS REFERENCES
Changing established street grade - see Ohio R.C. 727.07
1317.01 PROHIBITION OF CERTAIN GRADE CHANGES.
   No person shall, by filling or by other means, change the grade or surface
of any lot or parcel of land within the Village in such a manner as to do any
of the following acts:
   (a)   Create a nuisance upon such property by obstruction of the natural
drainage of water from such property;
   (b)   Adversely affect adjacent private or public property by the diversion
of surface water onto such adjacent property, by any increase in the rate of
run-off of surface water onto such adjacent property or by any interference
with or obstruction of the natural drainage of water from such adjacent
property; or
   (c)   Interfere with or obstruct any public water system or any public
sanitary or public storm sewer system.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1317.02 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall change the grade on any parcel of land in the Village or
place any fill in excess of ten cubic yards and of any nature, such as soil,
rock, stone, or other material, on any lot or parcel of land within the Village
without first obtaining a permit from the Inspector of Buildings in accordance
with the provisions of this chapter. A permit shall not be required for
ordinary landscaping, which is not intended to change the grade or be used as
fill, such as the placement of topsoil, mulch, or landscaping rocks or
boulders.
(Ord. 2016-02-06. Passed 4-6-16.)
1317.03 APPLICATION FOR PERMIT.
   (a)   No person who attempts to change the grade or to place fill in the
amount of eleven (11) cubic yards or more on any lot or parcel of land within
the Village shall fail to apply to the Inspector of Buildings for a permit
therefor, using an application form furnished by the Inspector. Such person
shall pay a permit fee, submit plans, or post a cash deposit to pay for an
engineering review according to the following schedule:
 
Cubic Yard of Permit   Size of Lot/                           Plan
Fill per      Required Parcel       Permit Fee Cash Deposit   Required
